reviewText: Very solid puzzle game. I thought initially that 100 levels would be quick to burn through, but as of writing this review I haven't breached 30. You can see from the screenshots and trailers what kind of game this is, so if it looks like your kind of thing, you won't be disappointed.\n\nI will say that it's not terribly relaxing unless you turn SFX down to around 15-20% (from 100%)- but after I did that, no complaints at all, definitely worth the asking price.
voteText: 9 of 9 people (100%) found this review helpful

reviewText: WOW - my little grey cells are burning.... this is a deceptively difficult game, contrary to what it may seem on the surface. It gets challenging very quickly so if you feel the need to hone your wits, this is a great place to do so. No timer, no pressure - just you versus the LOOP.... highly recommended to those who appreciate a good puzzle.
voteText: 8 of 8 people (100%) found this review helpful 1 person found this review funny

reviewText:
First impression: solid puzzle game.

You swap pieces to make loops; some piece can't be swapped, but those can rotate, or they can change color. Like similar games, this is challenging, but not too difficult.

Thjere are 100 handcrafted levels, a level generator, and even an achievement for doing 1000 of these. There's a colorblind mode. The price is right, too.

Recommended.
voteText: 6 of 6 people (100%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
I don't usually review games, but this one is special. A nice puzzle game that can be played either as brain workout and try to figure out where pieces go to form the final shape with logic and visualization or played by just moving things around until you get a flash of inspiration and complete the level. I prefer to just move things around but some times it's nice to try and see if you can figure what the shape is with all the pieces scattered around.

I backed this game on kickstarter so I got a couple more hours of play and I'm still not even close to level 100.

Definetly worth the price if you are into puzzle games. As was said, maybe just lower the volume a bit and it can be pretty relaxing. I wish a negative mod would be added, all that white can be blinding.
voteText: 5 of 5 people (100%) found this review helpful

reviewText: This is an absolutely great chill out puzzler in the same vein as Hexcells, in that the rules" are very simple
date: the look and feel is very relaxed and minimal
recommended: soothing soundscapes are playing and while the first few puzzles are very easy
hoursPlayed: the game slowly ramps up the difficulty level without ever making it unfair.\nThe first many puzzles simply consist of switching around the pieces to form an abstract picture. Later
helpfulPercent: like pieces that can be turned and pieces that can change color.\nDefinitely check this one out if you need a new chillout puzzle fix!"

reviewText:
Created by a good friend of mine and I've spent a lot more hours in the game, prior to it coming onto Steam. - Good Luck with the game John!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=75m2iMXTQ6E

LOOP is a tranquil puzzle game, with a unique, simple, meditative feel. Complete each level by swapping the hexagon pieces until all the lines link up, revealing the final pattern. Later levels introduce spinning pieces and colour changing pieces also! - Recommended!

reviewText: Very nice game. Challenging puzzles!\nIf you love puzzle games, and some of them are easy for you (like Lyne and Ichi or Strata - all three are great games but for me just relaxing and too easy :) ), this could be a nice challenge.\n10/10 :)

Buy it! This game would make a fortune on android and iphone. A good quality game to add to your library.

Great game for under a fiver.  The puzzles are challenging and require thought, the music and sound effects are really relaxing and the graphics are bright and vivid, with a colour blind option if needed.  The aim is to rotate, swap and change colours and shapes until you get a series of connecting loops, much harder than it sounds.  I've played it for 3 hours and i am about 30% of the way through the game, so great value for money. It is exactly what it says it is a tranquil puzzle game".

8/10 - hopefully more updates and puzzles will be added to it."

A very nice puzzle game, lasting for a few hours. Fun puzzles that can get quite intricate, but not impossible to solve with (some help of) methodical approach. No timers, no move counts, and relaxing BGM make the boards feel a lot less like a challenge.\n\nSadly, there are only 100 boards, with very limited variety of twists to boot. Nonetheless, good puzzle game, would recommend.

reviewText:
I would have hoped for this puzzle game to be a bit more... puzzly. Most puzzle games that I enjoy require some kind of insight to proceed, or at least, are designed such that strategic thinking is superior to trial and error. You apply logic, derive a pattern and act on it.

This game on the other hand does not reward thinking much. The best strategy seems to be: Find pieces that fit the border (usually this will yield a unique partial solution) and go from there (usually there is a unique way to do so). This took me through the hundred levels in roughly six hours with little cause to reconsider my strategy. It's not super boring (you can listen to music or podcasts in the background) but does not provide an interesting challenge either.

I would have hoped for more clever puzzles. There are topological and graph theoretic insights that levels could be built upon, such as:

• Any cut through the level crosses an even number of lines (of each colour).
• The curvature of each loop must sum up to a multiple of 360°.
• If there are crossings between red and blue lines, then this number of crossings must be even.
• The number of times line segments connect to the left end of a hexagon equals the number of times that a connects to the right (for each colour. the same for the other two directions).

I think it would have been possible to build new mechanics and levels around those mechanics that encourage and reward thinking about these things. Sadly, the existing levels are designed such that considerations of this kind are either useless or more tedious than just applying trial and error.

There are puzzle games out there that convey interesting logical insights and reward the application of them, making the player feel smart when solving a challenge. This is not one of these games.

reviewText: Clean, straightforward, not-too-hard, thinking puzzler.
The game is pretty chill and if you want to unwind by untwisting some knots, look no further.\n\nFollow-up: I've finally beaten it and I still recommend it.
Nice game to play if your feeling stressed, a glass of wine and a few levels of LOOP\nhighly recommended .well worth the asking price.

This is a great puzzle game!  It was perfect to kill time when my computer was rendering images and couldn't do anything strenuous.  I played it windowed and on fast graphics and it didn't seem to lag at all even with my render program hogging most of the cpu.  As for the game itself.. it's not fast to get through,  I logged 33 hours and probably 20 to 25 of those were spent actutally playing it, quite a bit of time for only 100 levels, and especially for the price.  The dificulty ramps up nice and steady, there was only one I got really stuck on about level 60ish but theyre were lots that were quite chalanging.  Buy it, you won't refret it.
Amazing game, so tranqual. Great for killing days upon days as you try to untangle the coils of logic. The only downside is that the journey has to eventually end.
Mesmerizing. You can get lost in it. Very Zen. The atmospheric music is a deft touch. 9.9/10 (Steam achievements?)
Tricky without being too difficult, calming while still being engaging.  I want more!
Addictive, takes a while to beat it. Unless you give up eating, sleeping, etc.etc. sleeping....Zzzzzzz.

Love the game, already totally into it. Low pressure puzzle solving. A lot of previous comments about acheivements but ultimately if it chills you out and you enjoy it to the point you can zone out I dont see an issue why you would need to know where you are at. Its immersive and simple (in a complex way?!), I think keeping it that way is fine. Thanks for making this Im thoroughly enjoying it.
100 levels is just not enough....
Incredibly fun and addictive! Starts off easy and becomes much more challenging. If you're into puzzle games, I highly recommend Loop, especially at such a low price!
The game is pretty chill and if you want to unwind by untwisting some knots, look no further.\n\nFollow-up: I've finally beaten it and I still recommend it.

What I loved is that Loop is inspired by Zen philosophy with a minimal UI that has no timers, move limit or score. That atmopshere allows you to just relax and focus on the puzzle at hand. No pressure, no stress, just the feeling of simple accomplishment when you finished each level.

You can see my full review at:

http://www.confidentgamers.com/a-relaxing-puzzler-called-loop/

This is an interesting puzzle game. It's entertaining enough and the concept is quite cool.

Pros:

- Puzzle concept is fun

- Color choice and art style is pleasant enough.

- Nice and low entry level for even the most casual of players

Cons:

- Difficulty curve is a bit too steep. The first few puzzles are very easy then they throw a very hard one at you!

- Soundtrack is very poor. With a puzzle game like this one, one can really take advantage and have a very pleasant soundtrack, instead they choose to put a rain background. I know some people might find that relaxing, but I would have preferred something more musical.

- A bit expensive, ideally I'd pay closer to 2 or 3 for this as there are comparable free puzzle flash games that are a bit more fun than this one.


All in all I will still give this a thumbs up as the game is very polished and clearly is a good effort by a small development team!

Love the game, already totally into it. Low pressure puzzle solving. A lot of previous comments about acheivements but ultimately if it chills you out and you enjoy it to the point you can zone out I dont see an issue why you would need to know where you are at. Its immersive and simple (in a complex way?!), I think keeping it that way is fine. Thanks for making this Im thoroughly enjoying it.

A very solid puzzle game.  I've played similar games in the past, but this one really gives the brain a bit of a work-out.  Randomly moving peices does sometimes work to try and find a starting point, but that's a very hit-or-miss approach.  Worth the money if you like puzzle games though.  A great addition to any puzzle lover's library.
